pyproct.protocol.refinement.Refiner module¶

Created on 11/02/2013

@author: victor

class pyproct.protocol.refinement.Refiner.Refiner(matrixHandler, trajectoryHandler, clustering_parameters, refinement_parameters, observer)[source]¶

Bases: pyproct.driver.observer.observable.Observable

Given a clustering, it tries to further separate its clusters. This way we expect to reduce the scaling problem.

KMedoidsAlgorithmClass¶

alias of KMedoidsAlgorithm

classmethod redefine_cluster_with_map(initial_cluster, new_cluster)[source]¶

It renames the elements of a cluster using a map array.For instance, if our dataset has 5 elements and the cluster to remap contains element 1, 3 and 4, then the elements map will remap 0->1, 1->3 and 2->4. This mapping is implemented as an array so map[0] = 1, map[1] = 3 and map[2] = 4.

classmethod repartition_with_kmedoids(initial_cluster, k, submatrix)[source]¶
run(clustering)[source]¶

Refine a clustering recursively using a k-means over each cluster. New clusters obtained from a cluster must have no noise and
